text: Site is down again, about to hop on and look into it
Ugggggh
<@U06DFL7BP> do you have the rsa key?
since you are awake and here...
cms is definitely working so it’s just the site/MT related
yes
can you share with me?
thx!!
dm'd
lmk if that’s not what you need!
restarting hercules...
aaand we’re back
going to look in the logs to see if i can find anything informative
having trouble locating the logs. might be that i’m still half awake. at any rate i’m going to finish getting ready, come in and dig deeper
Sigh. Thanks <@U167FL70V>
sure thing. will get to the bottom of this today

FYI here’s the plan of attack for the day: we’re not finding much helpful in the logs so it’s hard to tell if it’s media temple or the app or some combo of both. there’s a few steps we need to complete before being able to transition to heroku so mo is going to be working on that. i’m going to do some log digging/analysis to see if there’s any easy fixes we could shove in to help us get more info
if all goes well we should be able to transition to heroku by the end of the day today, but i will update closer to then
<@U167FL70V> for Benevolent Internet Overlord
thanks but i’ll take any less lofty title such as: wrangler of ucs site
thinking that we might want to do a temp pause on any site updates for the next day as we get things more stable
<@U1HKQRLMR> is the main person who would be making updates right? is there anyone else who might be going in there?
I shouldn't have any other updates to make this week so we should be good. I can hold off on blog content.
FYI, heading to media interview and won't be checking Slack for a bit.
cool thanks <@U1HKQRLMR>
probably not, but i'll drop an announcement in <#C02AXGXJQ|announce>
thx charles
Thanks, Charles
thanks charles
<http://i.imgur.com/nmVV632.gif>
Thanks Ewald
Aww come on
i know about slack controls too yo
<@U02613K0X> <@U02HAJ6JF>, is there a command i need to run locally to get /blogs to populate?  something about cache?
should just pull from the BE, i think
`/blog` right?
no s
:shade:
yes /blog
end(ish) of day update: we are looking good and running well on <http://herculesproduction.herokuapp.com/>

attachments.title: Uncorked Studios
attachments.text: A design and engineering firm that builds connected products for the digital and physical world. From smart devices and wearables to native iOS / Android apps and the platforms that support them, Uncorked helps its clients build innovative products with purpose. The team consists of experience and visual designers, strategists, hardware and software developers, and producers.

text: next steps are to plot out the DNS record changes we’ll need to make and make sure we’ve got all our bases covered (i’m feeling fairly confident on the google side but doing some checking heroku side)
if no objections or concerns, i’ll make the change later this evening
if everything goes well we can kill off media temple entirely tomorrow, and we’re already well positioned and close to getting stuff off of ec2
Just clicked around the heroku app and it’s lookin :thumbsup: The vid on the careers page should start loading once the page is accessed from <http://uncorkedstudios.com|uncorkedstudios.com>
thanks for looking through <@U02613K0X> it’s helpful to have any extra sets of eyes on this we can
in other news the heroku logs are sooo much betta than media temple
you can get them without ssh’ing in, they’re color coded and timestamped
Thanks for the update! Excited to have Media Temple behind us
<!channel>: site seems to be down for me :confused:
I'll take a look
thanks mo
Also got the email, just got home but can help if needed
Thanks everyone
haven’t made dns changes yet, was doing some research before pulling the trigger

after trying to restart server/app we’re getting 301s, which makes me believe it might be a nameserver misconfig on the mediatemple side. since i was already going to update our routing i’m just going for it now
i’ve made the changes on the google domain side and just need to wait for them to propagate
site is back, currently still on MT
we are now on heroku
initial load is a little slow, but that is part of next steps improvement
